meanings.sent1: The poor kitten's woe was evident in its sad eyes.
meanings.sent2: The soldier returned from war with a heart full of woe.
meanings.sent3: The woe of losing his favorite toy was quickly forgotten when he found a new one.
meanings.sent4: The woe of the storm left behind a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The old man's woe was etched on his weathered face.

meanings.definition: A cause of sorrow or distress
meanings.sent1: The broken vase was a woe for the clumsy child.
meanings.sent2: Losing a job can be a great woe for many families.
meanings.sent3: The woe of a flat tire delayed their journey but brought them closer together.
meanings.sent4: The woe of a leaky roof led to many sleepless nights.
meanings.sent5: The woe of a burnt dinner filled the kitchen with smoke.

meanings.sent1: Her woe over the loss of her pet was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The woe in his voice was palpable as he spoke of his departed friend.
meanings.sent3: The woe of a rainy day was turned into joy with a warm cup of tea.
meanings.sent4: The woe of a broken heart can take time to heal.
meanings.sent5: The woe of a missed opportunity lingered in her mind.
